meanings.sent2: She always seems to forebode the future accurately.
meanings.sent3: His ability to forebode the weather made him the unofficial meteorologist of the group.
meanings.sent4: The old man's words seemed to forebode a coming storm.
meanings.sent5: The eerie silence in the forest forebode danger ahead.

meanings.definition: A feeling or prediction of something bad happening
meanings.sent1: A sense of forebode lingered in the air.
meanings.sent2: Her forebode about the test turned out to be true.
meanings.sent3: The cat's constant meowing was a forebode of the impending thunderstorm.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds were a forebode of the heavy rain to come.
meanings.sent5: The howling wind was a clear forebode of the approaching hurricane.
